alert.note: Alert for Macon; Schley (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 04 at 6:27PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Macon, northeastern Schley and south central Taylor Counties through 700 PM EDT... At 627 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Ideal, or 8 miles northwest of Oglethorpe, moving southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Ideal and Bartlett. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
